headline.main: Big Carmakers Merge, Cautiously, Into the Self-Driving Lane

docs.abstract: Wheels column; automakers are struggling with decisions about driver-assistance technology; General Motors and Audi have devised systems similar to Tesla's Autopilot technology, but with safeguards to insure drivers stay alert; Ford Motor and Google say they prefer to develop fully self-driving cars because of basic flaw in all autopilot technology.

docs.abstract: Web governing body World Wide Web Consortium says it is close to completing global standard for online payments, working with Google, Facebook, Apple and other tech giants; standard calls for using web browser to store payment information, which will streamline process and prevent need for credit card numbers to be stored on countless databases; analysts say this standard has better chance of being adopted than earlier attempts because it does not require customers or merchants to use new method of payment.
